text.text: What does the "Reset Patient Statement Count" feature allow you to do?

text: The Reset Patient Statement Count feature allows you to reset the statement count for an individual patient account. The feature is enabled as long as the patient is not on a payment plan and at least one statement has been sent.

text.text: Can you explain how the feature works in ZOLL Billing?

text: By clicking the "Reset statement count" button, the statement count for this account will be reset to zero, and the "Statements Remaining" field will display a value of 3 again.

text.text: When might you need to use the "Reset Statement Count" button?

text: You might need to use the "Reset Statement Count" button if you want to send another statement. For example, if the credit score is over 600 (high) with a high likelihood to pay, you may want to send another statement.

text.text: Where can you find the "Reset Statement Count" button in ZOLL Billing?

text: The "Reset statement count" button is located on the Patient Billing table > Active tab > magnifying glass icon.

text.text: What conditions must be met for the "Reset Statement Count" button to be enabled?

text: The "Reset statement count" button will be enabled as long as the patient is not on a payment plan and at least one statement has been sent.
